info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 26 at 6:04AM CDT until May 26 at 7:41PM CDT by NWS Fort Worth TX
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas...
Denton Creek Near Justin affecting Denton County.
Trinity River At Dallas affecting Dallas County.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...
White Rock Creek Near White Rock Creek At Greenville Ave affecting Dallas County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...White Rock Creek near White Rock Creek At Greenville Ave.
* WHEN...From this morning to this evening.
* IMPACTS...At 88.0 feet, Moderate flooding will occur along the creek. Ball fields at Moss Park are completely flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:15 AM CDT Monday the stage was 86.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 84.0 feet. - Flood stage is 84.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage this morning to 71.8 feet late this afternoon. It will then rise to 72.0 feet late this afternoon. It will fall to 71.8 feet late this afternoon. It will then rise to 83.1 feet just after midnight tonight. It will fall again and remain below flood stage.
info.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.water.noaa.gov/wfo/FWD.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO THIS EVENING
